body_html:
@0fficer1 Yes
When I run tf.image_crop_and_resize on TX2, it return 0 or something wired like 3.9e-4.
I have tried version 1.3, 1.4, 1.6 on my TX2 and all failed.

I finally use tf.image.crop_to_bounding_box and tf.image.resize_images as an alternative. But now I have to handle the padding by my self.

Do you have better solutions?
body_text:
@0fficer1 Yes
When I run tf.image_crop_and_resize on TX2, it return 0 or something wired like 3.9e-4.
I have tried version 1.3, 1.4, 1.6 on my TX2 and all failed.
I finally use tf.image.crop_to_bounding_box and tf.image.resize_images as an alternative. But now I have to handle the padding by my self.
Do you have better solutions?
body:
@0fficer1 Yes
When I run `tf.image_crop_and_resize` on TX2, it return 0 or something wired like 3.9e-4. 
I have tried version 1.3, 1.4, 1.6 on my TX2 and all failed.

I finally use `tf.image.crop_to_bounding_box` and `tf.image.resize_images` as an alternative. But now I have to handle the padding by my self.

Do you have better solutions?
